title: Are QR codes relevant in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are QR codes relevant in 2020? QR codes are not used extensively for marketing but are important in 2020 with the use in banking transactions such as UPI, wallets and more. Due to the following reasons, QR codes are relevant in 2020: Easy scanning of QR codes In the market, applications of QR codes are getting popular because of an increase in awareness of consumers and ease of use with mobile devices. Several social media platforms such as Snapchat, Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook have incorporated scanning of QR codes in apps which helps users to follow accounts by just scanning the code.QR codes significant for packaging In 2020, QR codes can play a major role in packaging, specifically for food items. With the help of QR codes, users can scan and check the product details comprising information about ingredients and expiry date before purchasing. Recently, for manufacturers, it has become mandatory to put QR codes on the packaging of products.QR codes at retail outlets encourage shopping experience Nowadays, QR codes are broadly used by various brands at different outlets of retail to offer consumers a better experience of shopping.The store of Nike uses QR codes at outlets to members of Nike Plus having a mobile app of Nike installed on devices and give members the best experience. However, members of Nike Plus are rewarded by an app on entering the store and is the best way to gain customer attention. With the growing digital trend in the industry, we can expect QR to be a relevant thing in 2020.

In 2020, there is covid-19 that people can not stand too close to others and this situation makes QR code really useful. I used to give out my business card and connect with people but in such pandemic the only way I give out my information is using the vcard format QR code. I would like to share 3 benefits I found from using vcard format QR code: Your recipients will get all your contact information into their phone contacts automatically without any manual typing or copy/paste from another text source.Allow receivers to scan the QR code with vcard format by their native phone cameras without installing any additional app.Does not require receivers to give up their personal information in exchange of your contact information to third party websitesIn my opinion, QR code is very relevant in 2020.

Though QR Codes are not being used for marketing nowdays, still are very much relevant in 2020 with increased presence in banking transactions (Wallets, UPI etc) due to following reasons: While NFC is more seamless technology to carry out P2P transactions, NFC enabled phones are still costly whereas QR Code can be scanned by any normal camera phone.NFC tags needed to encoded via special device whereas QR Codes can be easily printed via any printer.Scanning a QR Code is anyday faster than entering the UPI ID or any key.With several new technologies trying to surpass this, we might have something new in 2020 but it will take time to get as popular as QR Code has become now.

But, all of that has changed. And as WIRED astutely observed, QR codes were 'just ahead of their time'. QR codes are being used by millions now. 2.71 billion people are using smartphones in 2019 and 90% of the population is estimated to have access to high-speed internet by 2020.
Definitely. is there any better image based technology that carries data compared to QR codes? I have yet to see 3D barcode.
QR code will be relevant for next 10 years due low cost as compared to other non contact reading systems. Gurjeet singh 09210377633 Delhi, India
